content:
In a nutshell, anxiety is the subjective belief that there is perceived threat to what you imagine yourself to be. It could be literally anything, but you do in fact know what it is if you probe you own brain, ask, and respond honestly.

An example of what you're describing could be if you have a belief of your imagined life in the future as a certain level of success/appearance/relationship/accomplishment, and then by failing to do something now you believe you are not on track to achieve what you imagined your life to be, causing it to be diminished. In this case a simple example could be "I want to be jacked by my next birthday" and then every time you skip the gym or eat poorly you will often feel anxiety because this is a threat/diminishment of your imagined identity in the future and there is growing uncertainty and risk of that outcome not occurring.
